channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2023070853
item.description:
Report X-2023070853

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-08T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A PACKAGE HANDLER PULLED OUT THE PACKAGE AND THE MANAGER NOTIFIED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA AND NOTICED THE PACKAGE IN QUESTION WAS CORROSIVE AND PLACED IT IN THE TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG. QA CHECKED OVER THE TRAILER TO ENSURE THERE WAS NO WETNESS IN THE TRAILER. QA BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS CRUSHED IN AT THE SIDE AND CAUSED THE CONTAINERS TO BECOME CRUSHED IN AND LEAK OUT THRU THE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB.

item.title: Report X-2023070787
item.description:
Report X-2023070787

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: TOPEKA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: LEAKING PKG WAS BROUGHT TO QA FOR INSPECTION. PKG WAS CONTAINED IN HAZ-MAT TOTE AND REMOVED FROM HIGH TRAFFIC AREA. DescribePack: TOP OF BOX WAS WET FROM PKG BEING LOADED UPSIDE DOWN AT SOME POINT IN SHIPMENT. NO CAPS ON PLASTIC BOTTLES AND SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED OUT OF SEAL. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS CONTAINED IN HAZ-MAT TOTE AND PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG AND REMOVED FROM HIGH TRAFFIC AREA.

item.title: Report E-2023070474
item.description:
Report E-2023070474

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: KINGMAN
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COFFEYVILLE RESOUCES CRUDE TRANSPORTATION, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Our transport driver was Southbound on K14 when it left the roadway to the West and then corrected back onto the roadway. Our transport driver then over-corrected and entered the West ditch again. The vehicle overturned and came to rest on its driver's side facing South. The tanker trailer was breached upon impact causing the contents (Ethanol) to leak out. The incident took place at 12:11pm. The roadway was shut down by Kansas Highway Patrol when they arrived at the scene around 12:30pm. Sedgwick County HAZ-Mat Response Team was was dispatched to mitigate the effects of the release. The Ethanol was released into the soil, which was dug up by our remediation crew over the following days. The K14 was opened back up at 7:30pm when the transport and trailer were towed away.

Report E-2023070452

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the one poly 275 gallon tote of acid magic (un1760 ) had a defective cap and that 6 ounces of product had been released. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023070417
item.description:
Report E-2023070417

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that 2 of the metal 5 gallon pails of primer (un1263) had been crushed by other freight and had released 10 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023070371
item.description:
Report E-2023070371

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-17
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The #1 compartment on the KAG Energy, LLC trailer began to leak after loading. It appears that an issue with a gasket on a valve caused the spill. Approximately 2500 gallons of diesel fuel was released. Virtually all of the spilled diesel fuel was captured in the shipper's containment system. HMRI Environmental responded to the scene and assisted with the product transfer and handled the remediation.
